plugin_desc: The K8S monitoring plugin is used to monitor the status and health of Kubernetes clusters, including the performance metrics of nodes, containers, and pods.

metrics.name: cluster_pod_count
metrics.description: It is used to count the total number of Pods currently present in the Kubernetes cluster. This metric returns the count of Pods running in the cluster, including those across all namespaces.

metrics.name: cluster_node_count
metrics.description: It is used to count the total number of nodes currently available in the Kubernetes cluster. This metric returns the number of nodes in the cluster, helping users understand the scale and resources of the cluster.

metrics.name: cluster_cpu_utilization
metrics.description: Represents the current CPU utilization of the cluster, typically expressed as a percentage.

metrics.name: cluster_memory_utilization
metrics.description: Shows the current memory utilization of the cluster, expressed as a percentage.

metrics.name: pod_status
metrics.description: Retrieves the current status of the Pod, such as Running, Stopped, etc.

metrics.name: pod_restart_count
metrics.description: Monitors the restart counts of containers in the Pod to assess stability and frequency of issues.

metrics.name: pod_cpu_utilization
metrics.description: Calculates the CPU utilization of a Pod, reflecting the difference between container CPU limits and requests.

metrics.name: pod_memory_utilization
metrics.description: Calculates the memory utilization of the Pod as a ratio of memory limits to requests.

metrics.name: pod_io_writes
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of I/O write operations performed by a specific Pod over a specified time period. The write count can help analyze the write demands of the application on the storage system.

metrics.name: pod_io_read
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of I/O read operations performed by a specific Pod over a specified time period. The read count can help analyze the read demands of the application on the storage system.

metrics.name: pod_network_in
metrics.description: Monitors the inbound network traffic of a Pod, calculated based on the number of containers and IPs.

metrics.name: pod_network_out
metrics.description: Monitors the outbound network traffic of a Pod, calculated based on the number of containers and IPs.

metrics.name: node_status_condition
metrics.description: Node Status indicates the current operational state of the node, such as “Running” or “Stopped.” It helps administrators monitor and manage nodes within the Kubernetes cluster.

metrics.name: node_cpu_utilization
metrics.description: CPU Utilization indicates the current usage level of the node's CPU relative to its total available CPU resources. Monitoring this metric helps identify CPU bottlenecks and optimize resource allocation.

metrics.name: node_memory_usage
metrics.description: Application Memory Usage represents the total amount of memory utilized by applications running on the node. This metric helps understand the memory demands of applications and their impact on system performance.

metrics.name: node_memory_utilization
metrics.description: Application Memory Utilization Rate is the ratio of memory used by the application to its configured memory limits. By monitoring this metric, users can determine if adjustments to memory limits are needed.

metrics.name: node_physical_memory_usage
metrics.description: Physical Memory Usage refers to the total amount of physical memory actually used by the node. Understanding this metric helps administrators identify if there is a need to expand physical memory to support higher loads.

metrics.name: node_physical_memory_utilization
metrics.description: Physical Memory Utilization Rate represents the percentage of physical memory used compared to the total available physical memory. This metric helps assess the memory pressure and health status of the node.

metrics.name: node_io_read
metrics.description: Disk Write Rate indicates the rate of write operations performed by the node over a specified period. This metric is crucial for monitoring the disk write performance of applications.

metrics.name: node_io_write
metrics.description: Disk Read Rate indicates the rate of read operations performed by the node over a specified period. This metric helps assess the data reading performance of applications and storage load.

metrics.name: node_network_receive
metrics.description: Network In refers to the volume of data traffic received through the network interface. Monitoring this metric helps analyze if network bandwidth is sufficient and the overall network performance.

metrics.name: node_network_transmit
metrics.description: Network Out refers to the volume of data traffic sent through the network interface. This metric helps understand the node's network egress demands and potential bottlenecks.

metrics.name: node_cpu_load1
metrics.description: 1 Minute Average Load indicates the average load on the system over the last minute. This metric helps provide a real-time understanding of the system’s load level.

metrics.name: node_cpu_load5
metrics.description: 5 Minute Average Load indicates the average load on the system over the last 5 minutes. This metric helps identify load trends and their impact on system performance.

metrics.name: node_cpu_load15
metrics.description: 15 Minute Average Load indicates the average load on the system over the last 15 minutes. Monitoring this metric helps administrators understand the long-term load state of the system.
